title.native: 機動戦士ガンダム 鉄血のオルフェンズ
title.romaji: Kidou Senshi Gundam: Tekketsu no Orphans
title.english: Mobile Suit GUNDAM Iron Blooded Orphans

description:
300 years after a great conflict between Earth and Mars known as the "Calamity War," a woman named Kudelia sets out on a journey to Earth to speak for the independence of the Martian city of Chryse, which is under the control of the Earth government. Escorting her is the private security company CGS members Mikazuki Augus and Orga Itsuka. When a group named Gjallarhorn attacks CGS and Kudelia, Orga sees this as a chance to rebel against CGS and launch a coup. Mikazuki and Orga are thrust into a new conflict. To fend off Gjallarhorn, Mikazuki rides an old mobile suit from the Calamity War, powered by a nuclear reactor, the Gundam Barbatos.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Polyamorous
tags.description: Features a character who is in a consenting relationship with multiple people at one time.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Yakuza
tags.description: Centered around Japanese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Space Opera
tags.description: Centers around space warfare, advanced technology, chivalric romance and adventure.

tags.name: Agriculture
tags.description: Prominently features agriculture practices.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Trains
tags.description: Prominently features trains.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

node.description: He made his full directorial debut with the release of [Honey and Clover II](https://anilist.co/anime/1142/Hachimitsu-to-Clover-II/) in 2006, after which he directed [Idolmaster: Xenoglossia](https://anilist.co/anime/1694/Idolmster-Xenoglossia/) in 2007, and [Toradora!](https://anilist.co/anime/4224/Toradora/) in 2008. He has also directed the spin-off series of [Toaru Majutsu no Index](https://anilist.co/anime/4654/Toaru-Majutsu-no-Index/), respectively named [Toaru Kagaku no Railgun](https://anilist.co/anime/6213/Toaru-Kagaku-no-Railgun/), which released in 2009.
Recipient of the Individual Award at The 16th Animation Kobe Awards in 2011.

__Graduated:__ Kunitachi College of Music (Department of Composition)

[Artist Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/masaruyokoyama) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaruyokoyama)

**Yokoyama Masaru** is a Japanese composer, arranger, keyboardist and programmer affiliated with Miracle Bus.

**Education:** Taisho University

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/itou_yu)

Her manga "[Koukoku no Shugosha](https://anilist.co/manga/34599/Koukoku-no-Shugosha/)", an adaptation of Daisuke Satou's novels, was a runner-up in the 9th Japanese Media Arts Awards, the 11th Tezuka Cultural Prize, and the 1st Manga Taisho Awards.

She is married to [Shigeki Maeshima](https://anilist.co/staff/111967/Shigeki-Maeshima).
Affiliated with KUSANAGI.

__Susumu Aketagawa__ is a Japanese sound director and the representative director of Magic Capsule. His son, [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074), is also a sound director working at Magic Capsule.

name.native: マン・ウィズ・ア・ミッション

node.description:
[Website](https://www.mwamjapan.info) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mwamofficial) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/MWAMofficial) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mwamofficial/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/MWAMjapan)

__Introduction:__
Man with a Mission, stylized as MAN WITH A MISSION or sometimes as MWAM is a Japanese rock band which was formed in Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan in 2010. This band currently consists five band members, with stage names of Tokyo Tanaka, Jean-Ken Johnny, Kamikaze Boy, DJ Santa Monica and Spear Rib.

MWAM's music style has been described as hard rock and dance rock. Their distinguishing feature is that all of the members wear differently designed wolf masks during both their concerts and their music videos. Many of their singles have been used as theme songs for a variety of anime, live-action movies, and video games.

__Biography:__
Before becoming popular, the band invented a back-story for why they wear wolf masks, which involves them being created as the "Ultimate Life Form" by [Jimi Hendrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimi_Hendrix), who is described by the band as being the doctor of the guitar and master wolf biologist. They were then frozen in Antarctica for years. While they were frozen, they had been listening to all kinds of music from all around the world, before later escaping and emerging onto the Japanese music scene.

The earliest debut of the band was in a number of live gigs at venues in the Shibuya area. The band organized an American tour in late 2010, which was called their "[Whisky a Go Go](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whisky_a_Go_Go)" tour and involved multiple gigs at night clubs in Los Angeles. The tour itself ended in November 2010. The end of their tour coincided with the release of their first mini album, ___Welcome to the New World___, in November as well, which went on to sell out in a number of stores across Japan. The mini album also spent six weeks on the [Oricon Top 100](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oricon) for number of sales. On April 29, 2011, they released a new single titled "Never Fxxkin' Mind the Rules". After the single release, the band started another music tour on March 7, 2011, called "Man with a Mission Japan Marking Tour 2011", which included 13 different performances across Japan. Their first full debut album, ___Man with a Mission___, released on June 8, 2011.

Soon after the release of their album, they participated in a major Japanese concert event, known as "[Summer Sonic 2011](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Summer_Sonic_Festival)" in mid-August, and also a number of other summer festivals, such as "Countdown Japan 11/12". Labeled by ___Eggman Magazine___ as the "Most Promising Newcomer", tickets to their show at the concert festival sold out within ten minutes. During the stream of concerts, their songs were also run on 27 of the major FM and AM radio broadcasting stations nationwide across Japan. On October 5, 2011, the band released an EP titled ___Trick or Treat___, which included a number of original songs and also cover songs, such as "[Smells Like Teen Spirit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smells_Like_Teen_Spirit)" by [Nirvana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nirvana_(band)). The members of Man with a Mission were also featured in a poster campaign by [Tower Records](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tower_Records) titled "___No Music, No Life?___", which began on September 13, 2011.

Continuation of biography here: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Man_with_a_Mission)

___Members:___
- Tokyo Tanaka (トーキョー・タナカ) - vocals, leader
- [Jean-Ken Johnny](https://anilist.co/staff/149135/JeanKen-Johnny) (ジャン・ケン・ジョニー) - guitar, vocals, rap
- [Kamikaze Boy](https://anilist.co/staff/149139/Kamikaze-Boy) (カミカゼ・ボーイ) - bass guitar, backing vocals
- DJ Santa Monica (DJサンタモニカ) - DJ, sampling
- Spear Rib (スペア・リブ) - drums

(Sources: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Man_with_a_Mission) | [ja.wikipedia.org](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/MAN_WITH_A_MISSION) | [mwamjapan.info](https://www.mwamjapan.info/profiles))

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miho_karasawa)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/miho_karasawa/)__

Miho Karasawa is a Japanese singer who was previously signed to Horipro and is currently signed to Lantis.  Since 2014, she has performed under the stage name True (stylized as TRUE). 

She has performed theme songs for [Buddy Complex](https://anilist.co/anime/20533/), [Gargantia on the Verdurous Planet](https://anilist.co/anime/16524), [Maria the Virgin Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/20840) and [Sound! Euphonium](https://anilist.co/anime/20912/), among others. Karasawa made her debut in 2000 with the release of the song "Anytime, Anywhere".

MISIA is a Japanese singer, songwriter, and record producer. Born in Nagasaki, Misia moved to Fukuoka at the age of 14 to pursue a recording career. There, she continued her secondary education and briefly attended Seinan Gakuin University before withdrawing to focus on her musical career. She was signed to BMG Japan in 1997, after auditioning for record producer Haruo Yoda.

name.native: ブルー・エンカウント

node.description:
__[Website](https://blueencount.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/BLUEN_official)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/blueencount_official/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/blueencountSMEJ)__

__Formed:__ 2004
__Genres:__ Rock (Mixture Rock, Indie Rock), Emo

__Introduction:__
Blue Encount (stylized as BLUE ENCOUNT), alternatively known under the abbreviation BLUEN is a Japanese four-piece rock band under record label Ki/oon Records (2014-), who have previously been under record label 美音 (Mio) (2013-2014)

__Biography:__
In 2003, Shunichi, Yuuya and Yoshihide met at a vocational school in the Kumamoto Prefecture, where they would later in 2004 form the band Blue Encount. The band's name derives from a jinx that says bands with a color in their name sells, as well as a movie that the vocalist Shunichi saw at a rental shop titled "Blue Encounter".

In 2006, at the TEENS' MUSIC FESTIVAL, which was sponsored by the Yamaha Music Promotion Association and Nippon Broadcasting, they participated in the Kyuushuu qualifying round as the Kumamoto Prefecture representative, but they did not advance to the national competition. The bassist at the time withdrew from the band to enter university, and after graduating from a certain college of technology Yuuya and Yoshihide came to Tokyo and began studying at the Tokyo School of Music College in Shibuya. Yuuta, a senior at a vocational school participated as a support member at the time.

In 2008, the band participated in Yamaha's "The 2nd Music Revolution JAPAN FINAL" as a representative of Tokyo FINAL. This is also when Yuuta officially decided to join the band.

In 2010, the band released their first mini album titled "The Beginning of the Beginning". The response on the album were not as expected, and the members of the band instead called it "The Dark Ages". After that, they went on a split tour with the bands ircle and SUPER BEAVER, and said that occasional advice from both of the bands was a large help to escape the "dark age" as they called it.

On April 11, 2012, the 2nd mini album "HALO EFFECT" was released. The title song "HALO" has helped increase the number of YouTube views, and the number of live shows started piling in for them as a band.

On November, 2013, they released a split album titled "BONEDS" with the bands [MY FIRST STORY](https://anilist.co/staff/127675/My-First-Story), AIR SWELL and [SWANKY DANK](https://anilist.co/staff/132868/SWANKY-DANK).

On September 10, 2014, they made a major debut under Ki/oon Music with their EP titled "TIMELESS ROOKIE", this is also when they left their previous record label titled 美音 (Mio).

On October 9, 2016, the band made had their first one-man live show held at the Nippon Budokan. The tickets sold out the same day and had 11.000 people pending for the show. In addition, during this live performance, they directy spoke with the producer of the Japanese television drama "THE LaST COP/ラストコップ", and was then scheduled to perform the theme song for the show. The drama first broadcasted on the October 29, which is when they made their first appearance in a serial TV drama as a unit.

__Members:__
- [Shunichi Tanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/148599/Shunichi-Tanabe) (田邊駿一) - vocalist, guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition (2004-)
- Yuuya Eguchi (江口雄也) - guitarist (2004-)
- Yuuta Tsujimura (辻村勇太) - bassist (2006-2008, as a support member) (2008-, as an official member)
- Yoshihide Takamura (高村佳秀) - drummer (2004-)

(Source: [Wikipedia (BLUE ENCOUNT)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/BLUE_ENCOUNT), edited)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miho_karasawa)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/miho_karasawa/)__

Miho Karasawa is a Japanese singer who was previously signed to Horipro and is currently signed to Lantis.  Since 2014, she has performed under the stage name True (stylized as TRUE). 

She has performed theme songs for [Buddy Complex](https://anilist.co/anime/20533/), [Gargantia on the Verdurous Planet](https://anilist.co/anime/16524), [Maria the Virgin Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/20840) and [Sound! Euphonium](https://anilist.co/anime/20912/), among others. Karasawa made her debut in 2000 with the release of the song "Anytime, Anywhere".

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ShiroSAGISU_twi)

__Non-Anime Credits:__ 
- Music composer for ''Neon Genesis Evangelion'' (N64, VG) (Japanese) 
- Music composer for ''Shining Force Neo'' (VG)
- Music composer for ''Attack on Titan (live-action movie)''
- Music composer for'' Attack on Titan II: End of the World (live-action movie)''
- Music composer for ''Shin Godzilla''
- Music composer for ''Shin Ultraman''

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ShiroSAGISU_twi)

__Non-Anime Credits:__ 
- Music composer for ''Neon Genesis Evangelion'' (N64, VG) (Japanese) 
- Music composer for ''Shining Force Neo'' (VG)
- Music composer for ''Attack on Titan (live-action movie)''
- Music composer for'' Attack on Titan II: End of the World (live-action movie)''
- Music composer for ''Shin Godzilla''
- Music composer for ''Shin Ultraman''
